sections.text: Brown’s MA in Economics trains students in advanced economic theory, econometrics, and applied analysis, preparing them for research or policy careers.

items: Core coursework in microeconomics, macroeconomics, and econometrics
Electives in applied micro, development, and finance
sections.text: Students receive rigorous training in economics fundamentals and conduct applied research under faculty guidance.

items: Bachelor’s degree with strong background in economics or math
Coursework in calculus, linear algebra, and statistics
GRE may be required by department
sections.text: Applicants should have a solid economics and math foundation, research potential, and clear academic motivation.
Graduates pursue positions in consulting, finance, public policy, or continue into PhD studies.
